item.title: [HADOOP-14949] TestKMS#testACLs fails intermittently
item.description:
We have seen some intermittent failures of this test:

Error Message

java.lang.AssertionError

Stack Trace

java.lang.AssertionError: Should not have been able to reencryptEncryptedKey
	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)
	at org.apache.hadoop.crypto.key.kms.server.TestKMS$11$15.run(TestKMS.java:1616)
	at org.apache.hadoop.crypto.key.kms.server.TestKMS$11$15.run(TestKMS.java:1608)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at javax.security.auth.Subject.doAs(Subject.java:415)
	at org.apache.hadoop.security.UserGroupInformation.doAs(UserGroupInformation.java:1917)
	at org.apache.hadoop.crypto.key.kms.server.TestKMS.doAs(TestKMS.java:313)
	at org.apache.hadoop.crypto.key.kms.server.TestKMS.access$100(TestKMS.java:97)

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
In the passing runs, the acl reloading is observed:

2017-10-13 16:35:29,055 INFO  KMSACLs - 'CREATE' ACL 'foo'
2017-10-13 16:35:29,055 INFO  KMSACLs - 'DELETE' ACL '*'
2017-10-13 16:35:29,055 INFO  KMSACLs - 'ROLLOVER' ACL '*'
2017-10-13 16:35:29,055 INFO  KMSACLs - 'GET' ACL '*'
2017-10-13 16:35:29,055 INFO  KMSACLs - 'GET_KEYS' ACL '*'
2017-10-13 16:35:29,055 INFO  KMSACLs - 'GET_METADATA' ACL '*'
2017-10-13 16:35:29,055 INFO  KMSACLs - 'SET_KEY_MATERIAL' ACL '*'
2017-10-13 16:35:29,055 INFO  KMSACLs - 'GENERATE_EEK' ACL 'foo'
2017-10-13 16:35:29,055 INFO  KMSACLs - 'DECRYPT_EEK' ACL '*'

This is not seen in the failed runs.

Let's improve the test to not depend on the file mtime and sleep, but be deterministic.

With the fix in patch 1, it passes 100 separate runs. http://dist-test.cloudera.org/job?job_id=hadoop.xiao.1507937904.2138
Previously the failure rate in our internal infra was ~30%.

+1 overall
